channel.title: Personal-Growth on FalconBlog
channel.description: Recent content in Personal-Growth on FalconBlog

item.title: Day 4
item.description:
January 4, 2025 - A Day of IoT, Linear Algebra, and Electrifying Robotics

IoT Workshop - Raspberry Pi
The day kicked off with an inspiring IoT workshop centred around the versatile Raspberry Pi. Split into two sessions:

  • Morning (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM): We explored foundational IoT concepts and set up the Raspberry Pi for various applications.
  • Afternoon (2:00 PM - 5:00 PM): This session focused on real-world IoT projects and experimentation, which deepened my understanding and excitement for this growing field.

Library Study Time: Vector Spaces and Subspaces
From 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM, I tucked myself away in the library for a focused study session on vector spaces and subspaces in linear algebra. The clarity I gained during this time was immensely satisfying.

item.title: Day 3
item.description:
Today’s Progress - January 3, 2025

  • Successfully Passed Driving Test: Thrilled to have earned my driving license today! It was an amazing experience, and all the practice finally paid off.

  • Boarded Train and Met Classmate: During the journey, I caught up with a classmate. We had an enriching discussion and learned more about neural networks, Support Vector Machines (SVM), and tools like Zettelkasten in Obsidian.

  • Arrived at Campus: Got picked up by my cousin upon arrival, reached IIT Madras, and settled into my room.

item.title: Day 2
item.description:
Today’s Progress - January 2, 2025

  • Final Driving Lesson in the Morning: Completed the final driving lesson today in preparation for tomorrow’s driving test. Feeling confident and excited about earning my license approval.

  • Last-Minute Packing: Finished all last-minute packing for the journey back to campus. Ensured that everything is organized and ready for a smooth transition.

  • Quality Time with Mom and Dad: Spent meaningful moments with my parents as they gave me their final thoughts and advice before I leave for the semester. Grateful for their support and encouragement.

item.title: Day 1
item.description:
Today’s Progress:

  • Completed ROS 2 4-wheeled robot simulation in Gazebo: Spent time configuring and simulating a robot model using Gazebo. It was an exciting hands-on experience, and I’m glad to see it working.

  • Set up my journal for the new year: Dedicated some time today to create a fresh journal layout for 2025. This will help keep my daily progress and thoughts organized for the upcoming semester.

  • Shifted my laptop: Moved everything from my old system to my new one, ensuring that all my data and files are ready for the next phase of work. Everything’s now set up for easy access when I return to campus.

item.title: New Year New Me
item.description:
A New Year, A New Vision

As the new year unfolds, I’m reflecting on the journey so far and looking ahead to the exciting challenges and opportunities to come.

Academics and Aspirations

  • My focus remains on excelling in electrical engineering at IITM, diving deeper into semiconductor specialization, and staying aligned with my goal of securing a top-tier placement at companies like NVIDIA, Intel, and Amazon.
  • Beyond academics, I aim to sharpen my competitive programming skills, mastering problem-solving to stand out in tech challenges.

Building and Innovating

  • I’ve made strides in personal projects, from developing apps like Florafix to diving into open-source and honing my web development skills with frameworks like Hugo.
  • CTF challenges and exploring cybersecurity continue to expand my skill set and fuel my curiosity for problem-solving.

Health, Habits, and Growth

  • Discipline in routines like morning study sessions and mindful eating remain key to balancing my ambitions with personal well-being.
  • Music, podcasts, and meaningful interactions are helping me stay relaxed and creative.

The Road Ahead

2025 is about building momentum toward becoming financially stable and striving for excellence in all my endeavors, whether it’s academics, projects, or personal growth. It’s another step closer to the big dream of making an impact and supporting my family.
